nodes.title: pos
widgets_values: A friendly waitress in an Irish pub smiles warmly at the camera while holding up a rustic wooden tray. On the tray is a classic burger and fries meal, featuring a juicy burger with melted cheese, bacon, crisp lettuce, fresh tomato slices, and tangy pickle slices visible inside. The golden bun is sprinkled with sesame seeds, adding a rustic touch. The rendered scene shows the rich meat juices, enhancing the burger’s mouth-watering appeal. The tray also includes ketchup in small rustic bowls and a fresh, cool Coca-Cola with Carbon dioxide bubbles in it in a glass with ice cubes and a slice of lemon. The crispy, golden fries complement the meal perfectly. In the background on the left side, a man dressed in a Batman costume steps forward toward the foreground and confidently grabs the burger from the tray. The cozy pub ambiance with wooden interiors and soft lighting enhances the authentic, welcoming atmosphere.

nodes.title: 💡Info
widgets_values:
Bypassing SageAttention/Triton slightly improves quality but substantially increases generation time.

SageAttention and Trition significantly speed up generation, but are not installed in the standard ComfyUI. If you don't know how to install them, it's best to ask an AI. I asked [perplexity.ai](https://perplexity.ai) and was successfully guided through the installation step by step. Since the installation varies depending on the system, universal instructions cannot be provided here. Be sure to create a backup of ComfyUI beforehand, as problems during installation can also cause ComfyUI to stop working.

⚠️‼️If the output video is completely black, this indicates an error with the `sage_attention` model. You should then select the model variant that matches your system configuration. Bypass the group if SageAttention and Triton are not installed‼️⚠️

nodes.title: ℹ️Workflow INFO
widgets_values:
# VideoFlow Wan 2.2 I2V v1.0

This image-to-video workflow was developed to create realistic videos at 32 fps, with a focus on fast generation in high resolution.  
  
💡The quality of the input image primarily influences the quality of the output video. Therefore, low-quality input images usually produce low-quality videos. Try [PhotoFlow](https://civitai.com/models/1376005?modelVersionId=2139865) to create high resolution images.  


## Required Models Downloads

### Wan 2.2 Models
For video generation, a high noise and a low noise I2V model are required. 

Save path 📂`ComfyUI/models/diffusion_models`:  

If you have 16GB or 24GB of VRAM, the fp8 safetenors model is recommended:  
[Download High Noise](https://civitai.com/models/1817671?modelVersionId=2057465) `wanVideo22_i2vHighNoise14BFp8Sd.safetensors`  
[Download Low Noise](https://civitai.com/models/1817671?modelVersionId=2057270) `wanVideo22_i2vLowNoise14BFp8Scd.safetensors`  

A slower alternative with little bit better quality is the Q8_0 GGUF model:    
[Download High Noise](https://huggingface.co/bullerwins/Wan2.2-I2V-A14B-GGUF/resolve/main/wan2.2_i2v_high_noise_14B_Q8_0.gguf?download=true) `wan2.2_i2v_high_noise_14B_Q8_0.gguf`   
[Download Low Noise](https://huggingface.co/bullerwins/Wan2.2-I2V-A14B-GGUF/resolve/main/wan2.2_i2v_low_noise_14B_Q8_0.gguf?download=true) `wan2.2_i2v_low_noise_14B_Q8_0.gguf`   

If you have a GPU with 32GB of VRAM or more, you can use the full-size safetensors model for maximum quality:  
[Download High Noise](https://civitai.com/models/1817671?modelVersionId=2058318) `wanVideo22_i2vHighNoise14BFp16.safetensors`  
[Download Low Noise](https://civitai.com/models/1817671?modelVersionId=2058116) `wanVideo22_i2vLowNoise14BFp16.safetensors`  

If your GPU has less than 16GB VRAM, choose GGUF models smaller than your VRAM size:    
[Downloads](https://huggingface.co/bullerwins/Wan2.2-I2V-A14B-GGUF/tree/main)


|💡If you do not plan to use GGUF models, you can safely remove all nodes located above the **Load High Noise safetensors Model** node. If you only use GGUF models, you may delete the nodes between **Load Low Noise GGUF Model** and **Load CLIP**.|
|---|

### Wan Text Encoder
Save path 📂`ComfyUI/models/text_encoders`:  

fp8 (recommended):  
[Download](https://huggingface.co/Comfy-Org/Wan_2.1_ComfyUI_repackaged/resolve/main/split_files/text_encoders/umt5_xxl_fp8_e4m3fn_scaled.safetensors?download=true) `umt5_xxl_fp8_e4m3fn_scaled.safetensors`  

or fp16 (best prompt adaption):  
[Download](https://huggingface.co/Comfy-Org/Wan_2.1_ComfyUI_repackaged/resolve/main/split_files/text_encoders/umt5_xxl_fp16.safetensors) `umt5_xxl_fp16.safetensors`

### Wan VAE
Save path 📂`ComfyUI\models\vae`:  
[Download](https://huggingface.co/Comfy-Org/Wan_2.1_ComfyUI_repackaged/resolve/main/split_files/vae/wan_2.1_vae.safetensors?download=true) `wan_2.1_vae.safetensors` (yes, 2.1 is correct)  

### Wan 2.2 I2V Lightning LoRAs (⚠️mandatory for default settings in this workflow)
Save path 📂`ComfyUI\models\loras`:  
[Download High Noise](https://huggingface.co/lightx2v/Wan2.2-Lightning/resolve/main/Wan2.2-I2V-A14B-4steps-lora-rank64-Seko-V1/high_noise_model.safetensors?download=true) `high_noise_model.safetensors` (rename it to `Wan2.2-I2V-A14B-4steps-lora-rank64-Seko-V1_high_noise_model.safetensors`)  
[Download Low Noise](https://huggingface.co/lightx2v/Wan2.2-Lightning/resolve/main/Wan2.2-I2V-A14B-4steps-lora-rank64-Seko-V1/low_noise_model.safetensors?download=true) `low_noise_model.safetensors` (rename it to `Wan2.2-I2V-A14B-4steps-lora-rank64-Seko-V1_low_noise_model.safetensors`)  

### Upscaler
Save path 📂`ComfyUI\models\upscale_models`:  
[Download](https://openmodeldb.info/models/4x-UniversalUpscalerV2-Neutral) `4x_UniversalUpscalerV2-Neutral_115000_swaG.pth` 

## Installation

### ComfyUI Manager Installation
[https://github.com/ltdrdata/ComfyUI-Manager?tab=readme-ov-file#comfyui-manager](https://github.com/ltdrdata/ComfyUI-Manager?tab=readme-ov-file#comfyui-manager)

### Installation of Missing Nodes

Missing nodes in this workflow are highlighted in red. To install them, open the ComfyUI Manager and click the 'Install Missing Custom Nodes' button. 

After the installation, restart ComfyUI and refresh the browser page.

### Recommended Default Values

**Shift:** 8 
💡 Wan 2.2 together with Lightning does not like other values than 8 very much. So be careful with this setting.


#### KSamplers
**Sampler:** euler  
**Scheduler:** beta  
**Steps:** 4 each sampler  
**CFG:** 2.5, 1.0, 1.0 (2.5 can be adjusted, Lightning LoRA requires 1.0) 

#### RIFE VFI  
To increase the frame rate, interpolation images must be generated.  
**ckpt_name:** rife47 or rife49  
**clear_cache_after_n_frames:** 10 (⚠️‼️lower the value if you run out of memory‼️⚠️)  
**fast_mode**: *ignored*  
**ensemble:** true  
**scale_factor:** 1  

#### Combine Images to Video
**Format:** video/h264-mp4  
**pix_fmt:** yuv420p  
**CRF:** 19 (Lower value increases quality, but also file size. 1 = maximum quality)

## Performance Tips
It's only a small improvement, but disabling graphics/hardware acceleration in your browser will free up a bit of VRAM, which can make the difference between slow data swapping and fast VRAM-only usage, especially with 16 GB of VRAM or less. Be sure to restart the browser after changing this setting. Keep in mind that this will negatively affect your browser's performance, particularly when watching high-resolution videos. Therefore, this is a temporary improvement intended only for ComfyUI. If you have a video player like VLC open while using ComfyUI, it is recommended to disable hardware acceleration in the Codecs settings as well.

## TL;DR
Check my Civitai profile for updates and other workflows: [https://civitai.com/user/ai839](https://civitai.com/user/ai839)

I would appreciate a positive review 👍 for this workflow on Civitai. If you upload videos to Civitai created using this workflow, I would be grateful if you could add this workflow as a resource. This would greatly support my work!

Please feel free to leave a comment or contact me via chat if you have any questions, issues, or suggestions.

nodes.title: 💡Final Video Generation Tips
widgets_values:
To stop after the initial video generation, simply mute the ✨Add Details group using the 🛑Fast Groups Muter node.

For fast upscaling without adding details, bypass ✨Add Details. To add details without upscaling, set the  `Upscale Factor` in the 🎬Resize Frames node to `1`. If you only want to increase the frame rate, bypass both ✨Add Details and 🎬Resize Frames.
You can easily control this using the 💤Fast Groups Bypasser node.
